intro: Manulea simpliciflora, commonly known as the simple-flowered manulea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has slender, succulent stems and lance-shaped leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. Manulea simpliciflora is often found growing in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand prolonged periods of drought.
